pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c3b63ed5fd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15130/commits/c3b63ed5fd152c58d8e96ebcb0903ba4c249c7ba)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Well spotted; all places you flagged still are linted against. I see this PR as making incremental improvements, not as fixing all instances. For instance, in the first lines you marked, the simp was non-flexible in *both* branches below, and one of them is fixed.
!bench
(Just out of paranoia.)

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7c5b39cd-26f7-439e-91ef-760e49c40771) for commit ae69ca92a9e56b5603989d8b13bca92d13e7ee6f.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/9e71a562-d873-4eb1-b46b-babcdbeb4be4/to/7c5b39cd-26f7-439e-91ef-760e49c40771) against commit 75defd205f298e1b8d4197cc1b81c598f01000d6.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10139260060/job/28032264218)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10139260060/job/28032263797)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thank you for this!

I just flagged the few places where I suspect that the linter should complain.

Overall, I like the changes!

Thank you for this!

I just flagged the few places where I suspect that the linter should complain.

Overall, I like the changes!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Shouldn't the linter notice that `simp [e]` modified the goal and `exact h‚ÇÅ` is therefore rigid and following a flexible tactic?
Same here: `rw` follows `simp`, right?
Here also `simp` and then `rw`?
Is this non-terminal?
It is flagged by the flexible linter, yes - as `simp` is a flexible tactic, but `rw` is rigid, and both act on `\goal`.
Right but there is still more here?
Do you prefer if I try to combine these?
If it's not too much trouble, yes

I tried: this leaves additional goals. I have squeezed the first simp instead (the list of lemma stayed the same).

Since the entire file is deprecated, I would prefer to leave it at this level of clean-up.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: more fixes for the flexible linter
